pullRequest.body:
This PR adds a version of the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality for positive semidefinite bilinear forms on modules over linearly ordered commutative rings, and applies it to restrict Coxeter weights for root systems.

---

```suggestion
lemma four_smul_rootForm_sq_eq_coxeterWeight_smul (i j : ι) :
```

```lean
lemma exists_int_eq_coxeterWeight (h : P.IsCrystallographic) (i j : ι) :
    ∃ z : ℤ, P.coxeterWeight i j = z := by
  obtain ⟨a, ha⟩ := P.isCrystallographic_iff.mp h i j
  obtain ⟨b, hb⟩ := P.isCrystallographic_iff.mp h j i
```

```suggestion
  have hn0 : P.coxeterWeight i j ≠ 0 :=

    have : Module.IsReflexive R M := P.toPerfectPairing.reflexive_left
    have : NoZeroSMulDivisors ℤ M := NoZeroSMulDivisors.int_of_charZero R M
    intro hc
    exact (P.infinite_of_linearly_independent_coxeterWeight_four i j h hc).not_finite inferInstance
  have h4 : P.coxeterWeight i j ≤ 4 := P.coxeterWeight_le_4 i j
  have : ∃ n : ℕ, P.coxeterWeight i j = n := by
    obtain ⟨z, hz⟩ := P.exists_int_eq_coxeterWeight hP i j

    exact ⟨n, by simp [hz]⟩
  obtain ⟨n, hcn⟩ := this
```

```suggestion
  simp only [map_sub, map_smul, sub_apply, smul_apply, smul_eq_mul, mul_sub,
    mul_comm (B x y) (B x x), mul_left_comm (B x y) (B x x)]
```

From here everything uses the same setup so let's pull out all the `variables`:
```suggestion

variable [LinearOrderedCommRing R] [AddCommGroup M] [Module R M] (B : LinearMap.BilinForm R M)

```
Note also that `Nontrivial R` (included below, possibly not used) follows from `LinearOrderedCommRing R` so we can omit it.

I think these can be unified as follows:
```suggestion
/-- The **Cauchy-Schwarz inequality** for positive semidefinite forms. -/
lemma apply_mul_apply_le_of_forall_zero_le (hs : ∀ x, 0 ≤ B x x) (x y : M) :
    (B x y) * (B y x) ≤ (B x x) * (B y y) := by
  have aux (x y : M) : 0 ≤ (B x x) * ((B x x) * (B y y) - (B x y) * (B y x)) := by
    rw [← apply_smul_sub_smul_sub_eq B x y]
    exact hs (B x y • x - B x x • y)
  rcases lt_or_le 0 (B x x) with hx | hx
  · exact sub_nonneg.mp <| nonneg_of_mul_nonneg_right (aux x y) hx
  · replace hx : B x x = 0 := le_antisymm hx (hs x)
    rcases lt_or_le 0 (B y y) with hy | hy
    · rw [mul_comm (B x y), mul_comm (B x x)]
      exact sub_nonneg.mp <| nonneg_of_mul_nonneg_right (aux y x) hy
    · replace hy : B y y = 0 := le_antisymm hy (hs y)
      suffices B x y = - B y x by simpa [this, hx, hy] using mul_self_nonneg (B y x)
      rw [eq_neg_iff_add_eq_zero]
      apply le_antisymm
      · simpa only [hx, hy, map_sub, sub_apply, zero_sub, sub_zero, sub_nonneg,
          le_neg_iff_add_nonpos_left, add_comm (B y x)] using hs (x - y)
      · simpa [hx, hy] using hs (x + y)
```


Optionally (though feel free to omit) I think it would be nice to add:
```lean
lemma apply_mul_apply_lt_iff_linearIndependent [NoZeroSMulDivisors R M]
    (hp : ∀ x, x ≠ 0 → 0 < B x x) (x y : M) :
    (B x y) * (B y x) < (B x x) * (B y y) ↔ LinearIndependent R ![x, y] := by
  sorry -- `LinearIndependent.pair_iff` should be helpful
```
(note that `Domain R` follows from `LinearOrderedCommRing R`)

Since symmetric bilinear forms are so much more common, I think it would be worth adding specialisations of some of the above which also consume the hypothesis `B.IsSymm` and make statements about `(B x y) ^ 2` instead of `B x y * B y x`.

Partial golf:
```suggestion
  set li := P.RootForm (P.root i) (P.root i)
  set lj := P.RootForm (P.root j) (P.root j)
  set lij := P.RootForm (P.root i) (P.root j)
  have hi := P.rootForm_root_self_pos i
  have hj := P.rootForm_root_self_pos j
  have cs : 4 * lij ^ 2 ≤ 4 * (li * lj) := by
    rw [mul_le_mul_left four_pos]
    -- This should become a one-liner (or almost) with the right version of Cauchy-Schwarz
    have := LinearMap.BilinForm.inner_mul_inner_le P.RootForm P.rootForm_self_non_neg hi (P.root j)
    rw [sq]
    rwa [show P.RootForm (P.root j) (P.root i) = P.RootForm (P.root i) (P.root j) by
      apply rootForm_symmetric] at this
  have key : 4 • lij ^ 2 = _ • (li * lj) := P.four_smul_rootForm_sq_eq_coxeterWeight_smul i j
  simp only [nsmul_eq_mul, smul_eq_mul, Nat.cast_ofNat] at key
  rwa [key, mul_le_mul_right (by positivity)] at cs
```

I think `git merge master` has brought these back as zombies after I moved them to `CanonicalBilinear.lean` in #19645 (partly to relax order assumption on their scalars)
```suggestion
```



I think it is worth first proving:
```lean
lemma coxeterWeight_mem_set_of_isCrystallographic (i j : ι) (hP : P.IsCrystallographic) :
    P.coxeterWeight i j ∈ ({0, 1, 2, 3, 4} : Set R) := by
  obtain ⟨n, hcn⟩ : ∃ n : ℕ, P.coxeterWeight i j = n := by
    obtain ⟨z, hz⟩ := P.exists_int_eq_coxeterWeight hP i j
    have hz₀ : 0 ≤ z := by simpa [hz] using P.coxeterWeight_non_neg P.RootForm i j
    obtain ⟨n, rfl⟩ := Int.eq_ofNat_of_zero_le hz₀
    exact ⟨n, by simp [hz]⟩
  have : P.coxeterWeight i j ≤ 4 := P.coxeterWeight_le_four i j
  simp only [hcn, mem_insert_iff, mem_singleton_iff] at this ⊢
  norm_cast at this ⊢
  omega
```
and also adding the following convenience lemma in `RootSystem.Basic` just below the line which reads `variable [Finite ι] (P : RootPairing ι R M N) (i j : ι)`:
```lean
lemma coxeterWeight_ne_four_of_linearIndependent [CharZero R] [NoZeroSMulDivisors ℤ M]
    (hl : LinearIndependent R ![P.root i, P.root j]) :
    P.coxeterWeight i j ≠ 4 := by
  intro contra
  have := P.infinite_of_linearIndependent_coxeterWeight_four i j hl contra
  exact not_finite ι
```
and then it might not even be necessary to have `coxeterWeight_eq_one_or_two_or_three` but if you think it is worth keeping, it can be proved very quickly from these pieces.
